DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD CUP USA ' 94 / THE FIRST ROUND ; SPOTLIGHT ; DUTCH_TREAT IRISH TOTS
DOC.TEXT: Three Dutch businessmen paid_for a trip to Orlando for the World Cup for 200 underprivileged children from Dublin.According to the Orlando Sentinel , they did_it to show international friendship through soccer . " We want to show the world how nice soccer can be , " said Rob Schut , who owns a restaurant and gallery in Amsterdam . The children said they like the hot dogs , the pool and the hotels . They also said that , unlike most of the soccer teams playing here , they liked the weather , " because in Ireland , it would be freezing now. " MARTHA VARGAS-SEAGLE
